thread.title: The Restaurant Industry Chef Shuffles You Need To Know
thread.title_full: The Restaurant Industry Chef Shuffles You Need To Know

author: Eater Staff
title: The Restaurant Industry Chef Shuffles You Need To Know

organizations.name: restaurant industry chef shuffles you need to know park hyatt washington

text: Park Hyatt Washington executive chef Troy Knapp [Park Hyatt Washington] February 13, 2017 West End —Troy Knapp IN as executive chef of the Park Hyatt Washington hotel, following stints in Austin, Texas, Phoenix and San Antonio. February 2, 2017 ALEXANDRIA —Sebastien Rondier IN as executive chef at Brabo; former chef de cuisine Harper McClure to assist with the transition. 14th STREET —Alex Ureña IN as executive chef at Barcelona Wine Bar, following stints at restaurants across New York City. [Anna Greenberg/Barcelona Wine Bar] January 31, 2017 MIDDLEBURG —Ryan Arensdorf IN as executive chef at Salamander Resort & Spa. The Windy City transplant, who mostly recently served as chef de cuisine at the W Chicago Lakeshore, will now program menus for Harrimans Virginia Piedmont Grill, the Gold Cup Wine Bar, the resort’s in-room dining and banquet services. January 30, 2017 FOGGY BOTTOM —Erin Reed IN as pastry chef at Blue Duck Tavern. The Keystone State native is already playing up her Pennsylvania roots with regional accents including shoo fly tarts made with molasses pudding, and mini peppermint whoopie pies. SHIRLINGTON —Robert “Bo” Elliot IN as head brewer at Capitol City Brewing Company. The home brewer started with Cap City in August 2015 and has risen through the ranks. Elliot will oversee development of the seasonal brews to be featured at the 18th annual Oktoberfest. January 26, 2017 DOWNTOWN —Takeshi Nishikawa is IN as chef de cuisine at Lincoln, following stints at Restaurant Eve, Volt and New Heights Restaurant. [ T. Nishikawa/Facebook ] January 20, 2017 ADAMS MORGAN — Easton’s Bartlett Pear Inn co-owner Jordan Lloyd is stepping in at Mintwood Place to replace chef de cuisine Eric McKamey at the hot French-American eatery. Lloyd, who goes way back with exec chef/partner Cedric Maupillier during their early chef days at Citronelle, will bring back favorites like tagliatelle bolognese and escargot hush puppies. “Jordan came on board to refocus the restaurant to a more accessible neighborhood place...plus it will give me a break,” says Maupillier, who’s doing double duty between Mintwood and sister restaurant Convivial until Lloyd gets settled. Mintwood Place January 12, 2017 ARLINGTON —Chef Paul Murad and GM Kent Lawson, both previously of Boulevard, are IN at Marble & Rye. Murad is bringing many of the signature dishes he served up at Boulevard over to M&R. Many other workers from Boulevard are swapping over to Marble & Rye. January 4, 2017 MULTIPLE LOCATIONS —Alex Levin is IN (starting next month) as Executive Pastry Chef at the Schlow Restaurant Group. As per a release, Levin will “lead, manage and execute pastry programs” at SRG’s properties across the country, including The Riggsby and TICO in D.C. Levin most recently worked at Osteria Morini. December 27, 2016 PENN QUARTER —Joseph Pastore is IN as executive chef at Oceanaire. Pastore — who was on the opening team of The Oceanaire Seafood Room in Orlando — is replacing chef Sean Sanders. December 21, 2016 PENN QUARTER —Elizabeth Parker is IN as wine & beverage director, and Assistant GM, at Centrolina. Parker’s resume includes time at Rose’s Luxury, Crane & Turtle, Le Diplomate and Chez Billy Sud. DOWNTOWN —Brian Drosenos is IN as chef de cuisine for the The Lafayette Restaurant at the Hay-Adams, as well as Off The Record bar within the hotel. Drosenos spent his last half-decade working in California for Commune Hotels. December 15, 2016 U STREET— John Kerschensteiner is IN as chef de cuisine at The Fainting Goat. His resume includes time spent at Rogue 24, Graffiato, and 1789. VIRGINIA— The Ashby Inn is now under the leadership of Tom Whitaker. He worked for several years at the luxury Fearrington House Inn & Restaurant in North Carolina. LOGAN CIRCLE— Birch & Barley has another new executive chef in Bill Williamson, formerly of The Riggsby and Osteria Morini. December 7, 2016 ALEXANDRIA— Bastille has a new general manager. Denny Lyon will now oversee the restaurant. He’s worked everywhere from Ceiba to Teatro Goldoni to Nellie’s Sports Bar. December 6, 2016 CLEVELAND PARK— Ripple has found its new executive chef. It’s Ryan Ratino, who previously worked for Masa 14 (and expanding its tasting counter there). He’ll start at the gig in January. December 2, 2016 CHEVY CHASE— Tyler Stout is the new chef de cuisine at Macon Bistro & Larder. His local resume includes stints at Newton’s Table, Barrel and Crow, and some time as sous chef for Macon. November 30, 2016 CLEVELAND PARK/ADAMS MORGAN— Here’s a big one. Chef Marjorie Meek-Bradley is leaving both Ripple and Roofers Union. The chef tells The Washington Post that she wants to focus on her new sandwich shop, Smoked & Stacked. She’ll be replaced at Ripple, and the search is on — at Roofers Union, chef de cuisine Jenn Flynn will take over. [WaPo] November 29, 2016 SHAW— Convivial has a new sommelier in Diana Ziscovici. The sommelier is expanding the restaurant’s selection of rare French wines and cognacs, among other additions. November 18, 2016 GEORGETOWN— Here’s a type of hire Eater doesn’t write about every day. Bourbon Steak has been brought on Mason Foster as the restaurant’s new “Cigar Sommelier.” The longtime server is now a certified tobacconist, receiving the certification from the Tobacconist University of Princeton. CLIFTON— Meagan Tighe is the new pastry chef at Trummer’s on Main. The chef recently worked at Dovetail and The Nomad Hotel in New York, as well as Vendue Hotel in Charleston. Expect new dishes like cinnamon sugar beignets. November 16, 2016 ALEXANDRIA— Brandon McDermott is IN over at Captain Gregory’s in Alexandria. The chef will revamp the food menu at the speakeasy-style cocktail bar, putting a bigger emphasis on local ingredients and small plates. He’ll also run the food program at the ownership’s upcoming Nocturne in D.C. McDermott most recently was the executive chef of Caboose Brewing Company, and also used to work at Lincoln. His new menu at Captain Gregory’s will launch in December; Nocturne is on tap for next year. November 10, 2016 FOGGY BOTTOM— Rachel Sergi is IN at The Next Whisky Bar at the newly-revamped Watergate Hotel. The longtime local bartender, who most recently ran the show over at Quarter+Glory, has worked at such restaurants as Bar Rouge, Ardeo/Bardeo, the former PS7’s, Jack Rose, Lincoln, and more. She’s also active in the DC Craft Bartenders Guild. Find her focusing on all things whiskey at her new workplace. Rachel Sergi Official November 9, 2016 MIDDLEBURG— Jeffrey Surma is the new executive chef for the Restaurant at the Goodstone. He oversaw McLean’s Capital Grille for fifteen years, and has also worked for several Ritz-Carlton properties. He plans to emphasize farm-to-table cooking in his new role. November 3, 2016 NATIONAL MALL — The acclaimed Mitsitam Cafe within the National Museum of the American Indian, has a new chef. The cafe devoted to the foods of Native American tribes and regions will now be under the guidance of chef Freddie Bitsoie (Navajo). Bitsoie recently oversaw the cuisine at Fire Rock Casino in Church Rock, New Mexico, and has more than ten years of experience incorporating Native American foods and ingredients into dishes with the help of his classical culinary training. The cafe has a new fall menu from Bitsoie that features a clam and sunchoke soup, a sumac-crusted bison tenderloin, and complete holiday meals with turkey and sides. Freddie Bitsoie (Navajo) Official ARLINGTON— James Martin will lead the kitchen at upcoming Arlington Spanish restaurant Pamplona. Martin’s resume includes time spent at Bourbon Steak, Restaurant Nora (where he was executive chef), Jean Georges in New York, and Vidalia. Pamplona is set to open sometime this month at 3100 Clarendon Blvd. with paellas, tapas, rabbit leg, and more. LOUDOUN COUNTY— Ben Cohen is now heading things up over at WK Hearth (part of The Wine Kitchen group of restaurants) in Purcellville. They’ve expanded the steak program there. More From Eater DC
